lines.text: So... we've been on a few missions together now.
Yeah. You're not bad out there.
Not bad? I saved your life twice!
...Fair point.
I appreciate it. Really.
That's the most genuine thing I've heard you say.
Don't get used to it.
Stella, I've been meaning to ask about your tactical approach.
My tactical approach? I just keep everyone alive.
Precisely. It's... refreshing.
Most people would call it reckless.
Most people prioritize objectives over people.
Not us. Never us.
Indeed. That's why I'm glad to serve alongside you.
Remember when we used to argue about strategy at the academy?
How could I forget? You were insufferably stubborn.
Funny, I remember you being the stubborn one.
Perhaps we both were. Are.
At least now we're stubborn on the same side.
A terrifying prospect for our enemies.
Maestra, can I ask you something?
Of course, darling.
Why did someone like you join FellowDivers?
Someone like me? A musician, you mean?
You could have had a peaceful life. Fame, fortune...
Music is about connecting with people, Stella.
What better way than fighting alongside them?
I... never thought of it that way.
We all find meaning in different ways.
You know, Vawn, we're quite the pair.
What do you mean?
You're all sharp edges and cold logic. I'm... well, I'm not.
And?
And somehow, we work beautifully together out there.
Your optimism balances my pessimism.
See? You do have feelings!
Don't tell anyone.
Maestra, you carry yourself with such grace.
Years of practice, my friend.
Yet I sense a weight beneath it.
We've all lost people, Tiberius.
Indeed. The curse of living long lives.
But also the blessing of remembering them.
A poignant way to view it.
Do you ever miss real weather?
Real weather?
You know, rain. Wind. Actual seasons.
Station life does get monotonous.
That's the first time I've heard you admit something bothers you.
I didn't say it bothers me.
Right. Of course not.
These rations are getting worse every cycle.
Ah, you've noticed.
How could I not? This tastes like recycled boot leather.
In my days in the military, we had a saying...
Let me guess - 'builds character'?
No, actually. We said it tasted like recycled boot leather.
You're in the training room every morning at 0600.
Routine is important.
I'm there at 0530.
I know. I hear you.
And yet you never join me.
Some prefer to train alone.
Fair enough.
I heard you playing last night.
Oh? Was I too loud?
No, it was beautiful. What was it called?
I don't know yet. I'm still composing it.
Well, it was lovely.
Thank you, darling. That means a lot.
